comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas A-1E Skyraider 132649 In overall USAF light gray with large number 2 on engine cowl. Last five of serial 32649 on base of tail. US AIR FORCE plus full US Navy serial number below horizontal tailplane. Large area of fuselage painted flat black to attempt protection against wear from engine exhaust gases. Aircraft in pristine condition. Parked on airfield apron without chocks. Built for the US Navy as an AD-5, becoming an A-1E after September 1962. A-1E Skyraider 132649 was transferred to the USAF as 52-132649 during the first half of the 1960s.. This aircraft was used in a famous rescue of a downed airman on March 10, 1966 at Special Forces camp A Shau in Vietnam, for which Major Bernard G. Fisher was awarded the Medal of Honor. One year after the above action the aircraft crashed on a training flight. Being well-used and in bad condition, it was sent back to the U.S. for scrapping. Fortunately its identity was recognized by a staff member at the scrapping site, and the aircraft was sent to the National Museum of the United States Air Force for preservation. The aircraft is on display in the Museum's Modern Flight gallery at Wright Patterson Air Force Base, Dayton, Ohio. www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/ (Above info gleaned from various sources) Info and pictures of A-1E 132649 from various websites: www.flickr.com/photos/james_orear/3277854174/ www.flickr.com/photos/james_orear/3277853994/ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Crashed_Douglas_A-1.jpg www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/shared/media/photodb/photos/051... www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/factsheets/factsheet.asp?id=3188 www.nationalmuseum.af.mil/factsheets/factsheet.asp?id=297 www.airport-data.com/aircraft/132649.html Colonel Bernard F. Fisher USAF Retired: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernard_Francis_Fisher www.flickr.com/photos/gwilmore/47724864 Color side profile of the aircraft: wp.scn.ru/en/ww3/a/593/3/5/28 1st Special Operation Squadron (SOS), USAF Serial: 2 (52-132649, ex BuNo.132649)
